duck: Book of Common Prayer - The Book of Common Prayer is the short title of a number of related prayer books used in the Anglican Communion, as well as by the Continuing Anglican, "Anglican realignment" and other Anglican ...
The Book of Divine Worship is an adaptation of the American Book of Common Prayer by the Roman Catholic Church.

Anglican Use - Anglican Use personal parishes in the United States were founded by former members of the Episcopal Church in the United States who join the Catholic Church as members of the Latin Rite and who ...

Anglican chant - Anglican chant is a way to sing un-metrical texts, such as prose translations of the psalms, canticles, and other, similar biblical texts by matching the natural speech-rhythm of the words in ea...
Roman Missal - The Roman Missal is the liturgical book that contains the texts and rubrics for the celebration of the Mass in the Roman Rite of the Catholic Church.
The Book of Divine Worship (BDW) is an adaptation of the American Book of Common Prayer (BCP) by the Roman Catholic Church.
Pastoral Provision - The "pastoral provision" or "statute" for United States Episcopalians entering the Catholic Church authorizes some departures from the normal practice of the Latin Rite.

wiki.text:
The 'Book of Divine Worship' '(BDW)' is an adaptation of the American Book of
Common Prayer (BCP) by the Roman Catholic Church. It is used primarily by former
members of the Episcopal Church within Anglican Use parishes.
wiki.title: Book%20of%20Divine%20Worship
